page.title: 06HISTORY OF ELLESMERE PORT
page.content: {Ellesmere Port}comprises villages that existed before the{Norman Conquest:} Whitby, Little Sutton, Great Sutton, Childer Thornton, Hooton, Thornton le Moors, Overpool, Great Stanney & Ince. From the{1086 Domesday survey until {1850}the area was owned by the{Church or,{after 1536,}by important{local {families.}At one time it was a "watering place" (holiday resort) for the wealthy in the area. In{1863}the area was linked by {railway}to Birkenhead and Helsby. In{1894 the Manchester Ship Canal}was completed. From{1900-1930}the area began to develop as a commercial centre engulfing the original vilages.In{1951 the area was {designated an overspill town for {Liverpool.}Excellent communications attracted many firms, still present today in a busy industrial town.
